newsitem.title: USA: W.R. Grace to divest four non-core businesses.
newsitem.headline: W.R. Grace to divest four non-core businesses.

text.p: W.R. Grace & Co. said Tuesday that it plans to divest four non-core businesses within six months in order to focus on its packaging and speciality chemicals businesses.
The company said the sales of the four units, which previously had been classified as discontinued operations, are expected to generate about $300 million in pre-tax proceeds.
Grace said the businesses -- Grace TEC Systems, Grace Speciality Polymers, Grace Cocoa and Amicon -- do not fit in with its strategy of becoming a dominant packaging and speciality chemicals company.
Grace TEC supplies dryers for the paper industry and Grace Speciality Polymers supplies materials used in making circuit boards and components.
Grace Cocoa produces and sells cocoa and chocolate while Amicon supplies biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies with molecular separation and purification products.

"We already have received interest from numerous parties for each of these businesses and, through the divestitures, we expect to generate greater value for Grace shareholders," the company said in a statement.
Grace's stock was up 37.50 cents at $54.625 in afternoon trading on the New York Stock Exchange.
